website_summaries.verdict: A less expensive hoe that proves to be both strong and durable.
pros: Great for light or medium weeding
Ideal for cutting out weeds in tight spaces
Easy to use and helps you finish the job quickly
cons: The handle on this hoe is a little shorter than others on the market

customer_reviews.title: THOUGHTLESS ENGINEERING
customer_reviews.text: Could be a nice tool, but the handle is too short for a normal size or larger person. Using this tool virtually guarantees back problems from having to awkwardly bend over. Literally an ergonomic disaster. Will either have to find a way to extend the handle length, or return this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Ben W. Trotter, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: this is a very nice hoe, very sharp good design
customer_reviews.text: this is a very nice hoe, very sharp good design, put together good but I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because it is advertised as a long handled hoe. The handle is not "long" it is short enough I have to bend over quite a bit to get the angle right to make it work, they need to make the handle longer or change the angle of the blade, ( or I guess they could just sell it to short people )
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... is good,but the handle is really not long enough like it's in the pic,and no Japanese words on the ...
customer_reviews.text: knife is good,but the handle is really not long enough like it's in the pic,and no Japanese words on the handle,So I think it is Imitation from original manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Yanfang Ji Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Handle too short
customer_reviews.text: I returned this product because the handle was too short to be used standing up. Seemed to be well made but You would have to squat or kneel or bend way over to use this.
customer_reviews.author: LagunaLady

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer in the War Against Weeds
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this triangular hoe. The fact that it’s made of stainless steel sealed the deal for me. It really takes care of a large area of weeds in mere minutes. Picking up the weeds afterwards is a chore, but it’s good knowing that you get the weeds out before they go to seed. To protect the steel, I made a sheath using scraps of leather, suede lace, rivets, and a rivet setter kit. I punched holes for weaving the suede lace with a leather hole puncher.
customer_reviews.author: Fran

customer_reviews.title: Better for shorter people
customer_reviews.text: This is product is better for women 5ft and under. I leave mine outside and it doesnt rush that is a plus. I am still getting use to it.
customer_reviews.author: johno

customer_reviews.title: NOT SAFE
customer_reviews.text: The packaging for shipment of this item was extremely unsafe. The blade is very sharp and was only encased in a thin plastic sheath. There was not carton around the blade. The plastic sheath that is intended to be reuseable is inadequate for safety. This should have a thicker leather or leather-like sheath. BE CAREFUL!
customer_reviews.author: Marigold

customer_reviews.title: Too short handle, painful to use.
customer_reviews.text: The blade is nice, however the handle is way too short and force me to bend in an uncomfortable angle while using. It leaves me whole night of backpain after deweeding. I guess the tool is designed according to average hight of Japanese, but it doesn't fit American market. I am only 5'5, it is already hard enough to use it, let alone the taller people. I won't recommend anyone taller than 5'5 to buy this tool, unless they make the handle 2 feet longer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: The long handle is great for cleaning up around thorny roses, I put it to the test by cleaning up larger areal of weeds but the blade bent over, It's fine for light to medium clean-up but I think I may have to spend the money for the diamond hoe.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor 1

customer_reviews.title: super cutter
customer_reviews.text: Well, I am impressed, the small size at first through me off, but as I used it I came to see the size as a plus, like a pitching wedge, a nice slightly angle stroke and my weed issue became a composting issue, even some nasty 3/8 inch thick like a tree weeds great like and very sharpe
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Miracle Hoe
customer_reviews.text: Initially I bought it for a different reason, to scrape the floor of my chicken house under the cages. I cut the handle down so I could use it at a certain level that was comfortable to me. Quickly though I found out what an unbelievable hoe it was!!!!! There are so many ways to turn the hoe to just get the weeds in your garden without hurting plants you don't want to hurt. I WILL NEVER BE WITHOUT THIS HOE EVER, I LOVE IT. Now when I have to go weed the garden, I jump up and enjoy killing weeds the natural way by cutting them down!!
customer_reviews.author: Pcful

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and very handy garden hoe
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the hand hoe, a nejiri gama, for the last growing season, and enjoying how easily it mows down weeds. Having to stoop over to use it was not pleasant, so I searched out and purchased this long handled nejiri. I reinforced the handle where the cutting blade attaches, using gorilla tape. I've only used it two days, but it is very effective. The blade has the advantage, just like the hand hoe, of being easy to sharpen. I've used it for the last week hitting the edges of my gardens. Very effective - but I've had to sharpen it twice!
customer_reviews.author: Meehlticket

customer_reviews.title: “Handheld” is the operative word.
customer_reviews.text: “Handheld Long Handle Draw Hoe” If you don’t pay attention to the operative word, “handheld,” and instead focus on “Long Handle Draw Hoe,” you might be surprised to receive a child-sized hoe. I was. It is without question the sturdiest child-sized garden tool I’ve ever seen. Or, alternatively, it is the longest handle I’ve ever seen on a sturdy, excellent quality hand tool. Unfortunately, it is not at all what I thought I’d be getting.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great garden tool
customer_reviews.text: Used to prep my raised beds this spring. Will continue to use throughout the growing season. Very sharp, cuts through weeds and broke up soil to add compost. Decent length but if you're tall you may wish it was a little longer. But a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Dsmack10

customer_reviews.title: Love my weed haters!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have two because my husband decided my first one should be kept in our attic but didn’t remember he put it there. I looked all over the garage and outside and I still couldn’t find my amazing weed hater so I ordered another. Guess what? Yep, he came across it in the attic. Now I have two for a tiny flower bed in a 200 s/f yard. Oh well, one for hoeing and one to use for defense against intruders. They are SHARP!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Yippie60

customer_reviews.title: You don't chop with this hole you cut by dragging it towards you.
customer_reviews.text: This neat little hoe is cool. Just lay it on the ground and pull it toward you. It slices the weeds off at ground level or even lower if you want to take another swipe at it I cleared a good two square yards in about 30 seconds with weeds about 3/8 of an inch thick.
customer_reviews.author: Typoman

customer_reviews.title: The blade bends
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely unhappy with this product. The head bent within 5 minutes of light use breaking up some monkey-grass and is now at an angle that is useless for any practical gardening. The metal is just too weak for a gardening tool.
customer_reviews.author: KLC

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely a lie to call this 'long handle'
customer_reviews.text: First, I like the hoe end - its sharp, light, and quickly cuts through the weeds. BUT - to call it 'long handle' is an absolute lie. Its seriously like 3 ft long - only a dwarf would call this 'long', so clearly they are misrepresenting it. I would have returned it immediately except that I have a drill press and will drill the rivets out, buy a legitimate regular human length handle, then slot it on my table saw... so, unless you have a woodworking shop handy to mod this, I wouldn't recommend buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Nate123

customer_reviews.title: great tool but the handle and blade are both too ...
customer_reviews.text: great tool but the handle and blade are both too short. the blade is maybe 4 inches in length. it's sharp and great for digging up weeds, overgrown grass areas and working around corners. would be nice to have a longer blade and adjustable handle.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great, useful tool for keeping control of the back yard. We've been overrun by morning glory vines, and the sharp little edge, and the long handle, make beating those vines back much less of a chore. Light, easy to use, it's held up well. Very pleased with it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Nina L

customer_reviews.title: Best Weeder
customer_reviews.text: I've used the short handled type for many years. This one is saving my back! And, the handle is helping me reach places I can't get with the shorter one. I have so many trellises and bunny proofing fences up, this is a huge help. It cuts the weeds below the surface and can be used like a traditional hoe as well. This is the only type weeder I use. This one seems to be good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Lu

customer_reviews.title: sharp as a razor and easy to control
customer_reviews.text: Ihave used it to cut out some grasses oround a few trees so far this season. I look forward to using it to weed in my flower beds, all 3000+sq ft of them. The tool is like a hand held one I have and I love it. The only thing different that would make this perfict is if it was left handed and a longer handle, but that might be just a little picky .
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Keep a whetstone if you are working around rocks
customer_reviews.text: This blade is SUPER light and works well for long days of cutting. The motion of far away from you toward you gets the best cut. I am 5'5" and love it. The blade will wear out the way I normally work, but it is worth it because I can reuse the handle if I do. Well made and sharp. Keep the cover!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding garden tool
customer_reviews.text: Excellent garden tool. I had previously purchased the short handle version of this hoe and liked it so much that I decided to purchase the longer handle hoe. Hoe is very sharp. It will readily cut through roots even in hard ground. Others have criticized the handle for being too short. I am 5'7" and find that the handle is the correct length. A longer handle would be in my way.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Sharp garden tool to clean weeds
customer_reviews.text: Good garden tool to clean up weeds between flower bed. Easy to reach and sharp Handle is little short for tall people I’m 5’2” and it is ok for me
customer_reviews.author: Huong T. Dinh

customer_reviews.title: Best gardening tool ever!
customer_reviews.text: The blade on this hoe is as sharp as a knife! It takes no effort at all to clear weeds! So much easier and faster than pulling weeds. My favorite gardening tool!
customer_reviews.author: Gracie

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp but too flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The product was a pleasure to use at first. Very sharp, especially after honing with a stone. However the neck needs to be more heavy-duty. It bends regularly now so the blade is at the wrong angle. Too bad. I would have given it five stars if the neck was sturdy enough.
customer_reviews.author: Ruskin Tomatoes

customer_reviews.title: Too light, for my hand.
customer_reviews.text: I like the blade is well honed and sharp, it could be 6" longer, but then the handle would be too thin to support the extra length, on the other hand, were the handle thicker, it would require more ergs to 'hoe' and the blade steel would be exposed to extra stress. It is perfect for light 'weeding', not recommended for heavy work. With that said, a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Thought Dancer

customer_reviews.title: Too short but very beautiful despite being made in China.
customer_reviews.text: Way too short. As a 5’9 male i cannot use this unless on my knees. Do not buy this unless you’re 60 inches or less. But honestly very very beautiful hoe for those who are shorter. Also it’s made in China like what is that about this is supposed to be a japanese product...lame. Buy American
customer_reviews.author: Liza Kritzman

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: This is a lot smaller than you would think since there is no size reference on Amazon. My photo compares it to my car keys. It's a very sharp hoe and should work well for smaller weeds. I love the fact that it is made in Japan, not China.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wood

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT, great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for; lightweight and sharp. It's blade size is just right to get between a weed and the plant you want to keep. Perfect for me, I"m 5"3. It may be too short for taller people but I take it with me every time I go out in the yard so I don't have to bend over and get those pesky weeds.
customer_reviews.author: Cheetah

customer_reviews.title: Short and sharp weeder
customer_reviews.text: I like this very sharp bladed weeder. I am 5’2” so the handle is fine. It is easier to use than a hoe & sharpens with a scissor sharpener- EASY is important with many garden beds.
customer_reviews.author: Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Saves stooping over for small weeds.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to handle for light weeding. Not necessary to stoop which is exactly what a 81 year old as myself likes.
customer_reviews.author: Rainlady

customer_reviews.title: A blessing
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful. Best weeder I have used in my 70 years. Well I did no use a weeder for the first 7 years. Lol. But this slices through the weed crown/root. Wish I had had this ar the beginning of the spring. Would have been a blessing.
customer_reviews.author: Taunya Kopke

customer_reviews.title: Indispensable tool
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this tool and can't imagine gardening without it. I initially wondered if I should have bought a smaller hand version of this tool, but have discovered this is light enough to use standing or like a hand tool. I think this is unbeatable for clearing weeds compared to any kind of hoe I've ever used in the past. But it's also great for precision weeding and even using to dig holes and create furrows.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Hyatt

customer_reviews.title: effective weed weapon
customer_reviews.text: I love this hoe!! I have no complaints about it. It is sharp, precise and ready to go. Makes weeding my garden easier.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Weed your garden with less effort and in half the time
customer_reviews.text: This garden tool is a game changer! The blade is sharp and because of its narrow shape it’s easier to pin point tough weeds in delicate ground cover such as dicondra from a standing position. No more sore lower back and knees. It also scrapes clumps of weeds much like a razor to whiskers with little effort. Works faster and cleaner than a standard garden hoe. I’m so pleased with this tool!
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Weeding tool.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cleaver garden tool. It has a sharp edge that gets under the roots of weeds and then you can just pull them right up. You can use this while standing.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Doe

customer_reviews.title: easy tool for women
customer_reviews.text: I am a seventy year old senior, but love to do all the gardening I can. This hoe is lightweight and easy to manipulate. The edge is sharp and does the job with the small amount of weed control that I have in my garden. Some might find the handle short, but I am 5'2'' and it's perfect! Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Hill

customer_reviews.title: Works well, sharp and good angle
customer_reviews.text: I am 5 ft 5 in and as other reviewers noted, it is a bit short. A longer handle would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: SJCE

customer_reviews.title: Not too my liking
customer_reviews.text: Probably I expected too much for the purchase amount. Blade too sharp for kid to use. Handle to short for an adult to use. Looks like it would break pretty easily. I use other tools.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tool for the right price.  Does a great job.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very handy garden tool. It is so much faster than by hand or traditional hoe. Only thing that could be better,would be a heavier handle, but then it would cost more. All in all, I am very pleased with this weeder , and my knees don’t hurt either!
customer_reviews.author: Holly Hoover

customer_reviews.title: It'll bend!
customer_reviews.text: Not the tool the shorter version is. Mine has bent in the bend and I have bent it back. I bends everytime you try to use it on anything bigger than a match stick.
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie Forester

customer_reviews.title: Ease and speed ridding weeds
customer_reviews.text: Makes scrapping weeds off at soil lever fast and easy. I've been able to reduce a hand weeding job from 1 hour to about 10-15 minutes standing up with little effort. Makes gardening great at my older age.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua SSP

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but short handle
customer_reviews.text: Works great for edging and general weeding. Just wish handle was slightly longer. I am 5’9’’; wife is 5’3’’ and feels a bit to short for both of us.
customer_reviews.author: sa

customer_reviews.title: Made in Japan.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Every tool I bought from this seller is amazing. Not very expensive, good quality, sharp, easy to use. I wish handle could be longer.
customer_reviews.author: winter berries

customer_reviews.title: Very good weeding tool.
customer_reviews.text: Sharp, easy to use from standing position. Can get around plants with ease, and no harm to the plants you want to save from the weeds. !!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Lanier

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and SHARP!
customer_reviews.text: Highly effective! Took one hour to do a job that would have taken me at least three. So light and functional that it blew my mind. Wish I had discovered this years ago, but everything in it's own time...
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Lane

customer_reviews.title: only for short people
customer_reviews.text: Although it's a long handled tool, it's short. you still have to bend slightly. I also have this tool w/12" and 18" handle. I like the 18" one best
customer_reviews.author: greenman

customer_reviews.title: The stainless steel blade is very high quality!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best garden weeder I have found. Some others I have had would bend and rust. This guy is tough! The only thing that would be better is if it had double sided blade. So you see it's right handed. Still I would buy it again for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Kendall

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool. I’ve been using it to break up dirt that was packed down very hard from the hoofs of my goats. I’m turning that field into a garden and this is a great tool for that.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Best tool in my shed
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought five of these. Kept two and gave away the rest for my favorite gardeners. Best precision tool I’ve ever bought. Not for picking through rocks. Get a heavy hoe for that.
customer_reviews.author: RJ Elrod

customer_reviews.title: Great garden tool
customer_reviews.text: Great tool very sharp. Cuts time in the garden and slices thru weeds like butter.. Be careful in touching the blade. It will cut..
customer_reviews.author: ALBERTO B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice an sharp!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good alternative for getting rid of weeds! I do not have time or energy to pull them anymore! So at least I can get them hacked off before they reseed!
customer_reviews.author: JoAnne Hess

customer_reviews.title: Handle too short to use comfortably, results in back strain
customer_reviews.text: Well made product. Does what it’s supposed to however the handle is entirely too short for someone 6’ tall. Because of this I had to return.
customer_reviews.author: Scott C

customer_reviews.title: Well made and does the job
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for a while and am very pleased with the quality of the product. I would buy again and recommend this to friends.
customer_reviews.author: James Lee

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE
customer_reviews.text: It is so wonderful--every home that has a yard NEED one. Love ours
customer_reviews.author: S L Riner

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Selective weeding extremely effective, a little technique twisting cuts them clean! No Herbicides!
customer_reviews.author: FerdJ

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Hi quality and easy to use. It's light and does the job. I,m happy I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Rainbow cloud

customer_reviews.title: no more backaches
customer_reviews.text: Really hard for me to bend down, this tool is perfect, I love it......very easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Maria West

customer_reviews.title: A gardener’s surgical tool
customer_reviews.text: Best tool I’ve purchased in a long time. Super light to delicately scrape weeds that try to invade my gardens.
customer_reviews.author: RJ Elrod

customer_reviews.title: a handy tool
customer_reviews.text: I had a similar tool for hand use but this one has the same capabilities to use while standing or reaching into difficult places. I find it very useful.
customer_reviews.author: David Herr

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and good quality but blade is too small.
customer_reviews.text: Sharp and good quality but blade is too small. This blade size would have be Ok for the short handle, but types of work I do with the long handle, this blade is not very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Morning Rose

customer_reviews.title: Can’t re attach handle if it breaks and it did😞
customer_reviews.text: Wish the hoe end could be removed to add a longer sturdier handler. Not for heavy gardening.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Dean

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful Garden Tool
customer_reviews.text: Delighted that this project worked precisely how I hoped. Easy to use and did the job great.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia M. Conway

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Got for my husband since he is the gardener in the family and he just loves them! He says they do all they say they will.
customer_reviews.author: Tracie

customer_reviews.title: It Hoes Very Well
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted this for her garden. She likes it. It works.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Bastian

customer_reviews.title: Makes me feel like a Ninja!
customer_reviews.text: Nifty tool. Lightweight and cuts much better than any hoe I've ever had. Doesn't require much exertion on my recuperating back,
customer_reviews.author: Charles Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Where has this been all my life
customer_reviews.text: Far superior to a regular hoe. Gotta give it to the Japanese.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Long Handle Hoe
customer_reviews.text: Works great for digging out weeds. Handle could be heavier.
customer_reviews.author: Hallee

customer_reviews.title: excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: I had a hoe with 2.5 head and it was taken. Could not find another, this is an excellent replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Smith

customer_reviews.title: Weak handle
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well for all of 20 minutes before the handle snapped at the base. The handle is really short. Like a children’s toy but more dangerous. It’s very sharp and cuts through grass well. The handle is extremely fragile though. I didn’t even through 5 sqft of my lawn before it broke.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Great tool to have in any garden
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Ok, not great
customer_reviews.text: The handle is broom handle weight. Also a bit short, even at my 5’6” height.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Great tool just wished it was longer (for taller people) and that the blade stayed sharp longer or easier to sharpened. But overall, great tool and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Wewels

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Well made and great for clearing small areas of weeds and unwanted vegetation.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore F. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Efficient
customer_reviews.text: This is super easy to use and it is efficient!
customer_reviews.author: arista flanagan

customer_reviews.title: Too short
customer_reviews.text: Worked pretty well but really hard on the back. I am only 5’6” and the handle is WAY too short. I find it works great for large raised beds though.
customer_reviews.author: Courty81

customer_reviews.title: Great tool I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: Blade is very sharp and easy to cut grass without bending my knee. The reason of leaving 4 stars is I wanted the shaft to be made more longer. I'm 5 feet tall, but if it's more longer, it would be more easier to handle it.
customer_reviews.author: Sakura

customer_reviews.title: I Love this tool
customer_reviews.text: I Love this tool ... I have a bad back , and this tool makes it very easy to get the weeds out of my garden.. everyone who garden s&would have this tool ...
customer_reviews.author: nancy mcpherson

customer_reviews.title: Too short!
customer_reviews.text: The handle is too short. The back hurt after using it. It Need to be longer.
customer_reviews.author: Jose A. Portillo

customer_reviews.title: Fits between the onions, garlic and shallots
customer_reviews.text: Works like a precision instrument: sharp, small, light. Easily cuts through tough weed roots and heavy clay soil. The long handle is a nice improvement over a similar hand tool I also own. What else can we find in Japan to make gardening tasks easier?
customer_reviews.author: Gordo

customer_reviews.title: No bending needed!
customer_reviews.text: The whole is great for Chopping off weeds without the need for bending over. I would recommend getting the long and short handle hoes.
customer_reviews.author: Pinks

customer_reviews.title: Very Sharp
customer_reviews.text: Blade is at the perfect angle to permit maximum force with minimum effort
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This tool removes unwanted vegetation like nobody's business. Sharp, well balanced.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick W. Elifritz

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this tool
customer_reviews.text: Bought two one for myself and one for friend! Great tool
customer_reviews.author: cathy

customer_reviews.title: Works well and easier for those who cannot kneel on ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well and easier for those who cannot kneel on the ground to use short handle version. Do not know how I went without this
customer_reviews.author: AC Matteson

customer_reviews.title: Great Hoe.
customer_reviews.text: A very lightweight hoe, extremely sharp, well made. Ideal for cleaning out weeds in tight small spaces.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Henney

customer_reviews.title: High quality product
customer_reviews.text: I have a sizable vegetable garden, this hoe has become my number-one favorite tool. Weeding has never been easier. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: msred

customer_reviews.title: No more bending
customer_reviews.text: I like that you can get weeds in crowded places with this tool.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Schweitzer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Garden Tool
customer_reviews.text: Best garden hoe I have ever used. Killer on tough weeds and fast and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: mrsbuttercup

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: very light. blows right through a garden full of grab grass.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M.

customer_reviews.title: great for your garden
customer_reviews.text: it was smaller than I expected but it works perfect for the flowerbeds.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Linda Armenta

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Have a short handled one too but this is better for digging weeds in the driveway etc
customer_reviews.author: Pipster

customer_reviews.title: I want to return it.
customer_reviews.text: Weak product, if you have gravels under ground this hoe isn't for that use, it bent and dent the metal. Very light handle but weak metal material made. I gave it a rating of "0". Not wroth the $25.00 maybe $2.00.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handle is too too short.
customer_reviews.text: Got it specifically for the long handle except the handle was too short even for a short person.
customer_reviews.author: run4ever

customer_reviews.title: Spindly handle
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent garden-lawn tool! The handle is a little weak, as you work through the larger flowers and garden plants.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great for flower beds and outstanding for removing unwanted vegetation,grass,weeds,and roots and etc.

product_meta.title: Nisaku NJP1010 Medium Length Nejiri Gama Sharpened Weeding Hoe, Authentic Tomita (Est. 1960) Japanese Stainless Steel, 4.5" Blade Width, Polished 45" Wood Handle
product_meta.description: Style:Nejiri Sharpened BladeThe Nisaku stainless steel Nejiri hoe is an excellent addition to anyone's collection of outdoor tools. Made from stainless steel, the blade durable & strong to withstand heavy use. The long handle is great for reaching far distances & avoiding back strain.
feature_bullets: ★ The NJP1010 nejiri Gama weeding hoe is part of an extensive line of Nisaku gardening tools including the #1 selling Hori-Hori Digging Knife on, the NJP650.

▲ Features: 4.5" Stainless Steel nejiri shaped blade can not only be used as a traditional hoe but also for weeding shallow roots with the sharp edge. 45" Medium length handle is long enough to avoid kneeling in the dirt, but short enough for easy storage and portability.

▲ multi-use: The handheld hoe is used by gardeners worldwide, and is perfect for tasks such as shaping soil, removing weeds, clearing soil of old crops or plant residue, and harvesting rooted vegetables.
▲ Quality: Made from authentic Tomita (Est. 1960) Japanese stainless steel by real metal craftsmen ensures that your Nisaku products will last for many seasons.

▲ Durability: Constructed with a shank that is forged in one piece to the blade instead of just being Welded and then secured to the handle with Steel rivets. This ensures your hoe is extremely durable, bend resistant, and has a lot of levering power.
▲ Great gift: A quality product with an elegant look makes a great gift for anyone in your life who loves to garden.

▲ About Us: Nisaku has a full line of outdoor products made using authentic Tomita Steel (Est. 1960) manufacturing techniques. We hope you love our product and check out our entire lineup of Japanese Steel tools.

▲ Questions? : Nisaku is exclusively distributed in the U. S by outdoor retailer SunJoe, makers of the famous SPX3000 Pressure Washer. Feel free to contact our customer service department if you have any questions or concerns.
